description: Pre-existing MFN tariff rates under the Harmonized Tariff Schedule apply to all imports.
Section 232 steel tariff in effect at 10% on steel products. Country exemptions apply for select partners.
Section 232 aluminium tariff in effect at 10% on aluminium products. Country exemptions apply for select partners.
Emergency tariff of 10% imposed on China and Hong Kong under IEEPA authority citing fentanyl crisis.
China synthetic opioid emergency tariff doubled from 10% to 20%.
Emergency tariffs imposed on Canada: 25% on non-energy goods and 10% on energy products citing northern border security.
Emergency tariff of 25% imposed on all Mexican imports under IEEPA authority.
Section 232 steel tariff doubled from 10% to 25%. Country exemptions revoked for all partners.
Section 232 aluminium tariff doubled from 10% to 25%. Country exemptions revoked for all partners.
Product-specific exceptions from IEEPA top-up for Brazil activated covering select agricultural and industrial goods.
Civil aircraft products covered by the WTO Agreement on Trade in Civil Aircraft excluded from IEEPA tariffs. Activated alongside IEEPA baseline on April 5.
Pharmaceutical products covered by WTO agreements excluded from IEEPA tariffs. Activated alongside IEEPA baseline on April 5.
Products covered by CAFTA-DR schedules excluded from IEEPA tariffs for eligible Central American partners.
Section 232 tariff of 25% imposed on passenger vehicles and light trucks.
Aluminium derivative products added to Section 232 scope at derivative incidence rates.
Universal 10% IEEPA baseline tariff applied to nearly all imports from all countries (except Canada and Mexico which face emergency rates).
First tranche of Annex 2 product exceptions from IEEPA tariffs activated covering select intermediate goods.
Semiconductors excluded from IEEPA tariffs.
Products with statutory exemptions from IEEPA authority excluded from tariffs.
China-specific IEEPA reciprocal top-up of 74 percentage points activated on top of the 10% baseline.
China-specific IEEPA reciprocal top-up increased from 74pp to 115pp.

event_name: China IEEPA top-up reduced to 0pp (Geneva deal)
description: China-specific IEEPA reciprocal top-up reduced to 0pp following the Geneva trade agreement.
Section 232 steel tariff increased from 25% to 50%.
Section 232 aluminium tariff increased from 25% to 50%.
Additional steel derivative products added to Section 232 scope.
UK bilateral deal establishing a 10% ceiling on auto/PV parts and 25% cap on steel/aluminium (within quota).
Section 232 tariff of 50% imposed on copper products.
Lumber product scope definitions loaded into Section 232 framework (tariff rates activated October 14).
Medium and heavy-duty vehicle product scope loaded into Section 232 framework (tariff rates activated November 1).
Canada northern border energy tariff component updated with expanded energy product scope.
Brazil-specific additional IEEPA top-up of 40 percentage points activated.
Country-specific IEEPA reciprocal top-ups activated for approximately 80 countries at varying rates (5-30pp depending on country).
Additional steel and aluminium derivative products added to Section 232 scope.
Additional surcharge of 25 percentage points imposed on India and Russia.
EU deal establishing 15% IEEPA and S232 floor rates with pharmaceutical exceptions and expanded product exception list.
Second tranche of Annex 2 product exceptions from IEEPA tariffs activated.
Japan deal establishing 15% IEEPA and S232 floor rates with lumber derivative provisions.
Section 232 lumber tariff activated at base rate of 10% with 25% on cabinet/vanity and upholstered furniture derivatives.
UK receives 10% lumber derivative rate; Japan and EU receive 15% lumber derivative rates under their bilateral deals.
Section 232 tariff of 25% imposed on medium and heavy-duty vehicles and parts.
Section 232 tariff of 25% imposed on passenger vehicle and light truck parts.
China synthetic opioid emergency tariff reduced from 20% back to 10%.
Third tranche of Annex 2 product exceptions from IEEPA tariffs activated.
Additional product-specific exceptions from IEEPA top-up for Brazil activated.
Korea deal establishing 15% IEEPA and S232 floor rates for automobiles with lumber derivative provisions and aircraft exceptions.
Switzerland and Liechtenstein deal establishing 15% IEEPA floor rate with pharma exceptions and product-specific exceptions.
